description:
mat-icon used as interactive without accessible label. Screen readers cannot announce icon-only buttons
  How to fix:
    - Add aria-label to parent button
    - Add visually-hidden text
    - Add aria-hidden="true" if purely decorative
  WCAG 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value | See: https://material.angular.io/components/icon/overview#accessibility
  Found: <mat-icon>info_outline</mat-icon>

Form input missing label. Screen readers cannot identify the input purpose
  How to fix:
    - Add <label for="inputId">
    - Add aria-label attribute
    - Add aria-labelledby referencing visible text
    - Wrap input in <label> element
  WCAG 3.3.2: Labels or Instructions
  Found: <input #fileInputEmpty type="file" accep...

Form input missing label. Screen readers cannot identify the input purpose
  How to fix:
    - Add <label for="inputId">
    - Add aria-label attribute
    - Add aria-labelledby referencing visible text
    - Wrap input in <label> element
  WCAG 3.3.2: Labels or Instructions
  Found: <input #fileInput type="file" accept...

Heading skips from h1 to h3. Screen reader users rely on heading hierarchy for navigation
  How to fix:
    - Use h2 instead of h3
    - Restructure content to follow logical hierarchy
  WCAG 1.3.1: Info and Relationships
  Found: <h3>

Click handler without keyboard support. Keyboard users cannot activate this element
  How to fix:
    - Add (keydown.enter) or (keydown.space) handler
    - Use <button> instead of <div> or <span>
    - Add tabindex="0" and keyboard event handlers
  WCAG 2.1.1: Keyboard
  Found: <div> (line 1)

Clickable element missing role. Screen readers cannot identify the element as interactive
  How to fix:
    - Use semantic element: <button>, <a>, <input>
    - Add role="button" with tabindex="0"
    - Add appropriate ARIA role
  WCAG 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value
  Found: <div> (line 1)
